fields.description:
Suppose I push a fix to a bug on a branch called "bugfix-123" and in my commit message I write "Blah, fixes BCLOUD-123".

In my opinion the issue is not resolved until it's in the main branch. It should not close the issue until my pull request has been merged.

The current behaviour is that the issue gets changed to resolved. If my branch never gets merged (pull request rejected, for example) the issue has not been resolved.

Furthermore I think it's particularly misleading for an observer of the repository to see issues set to resolved when they are in fact _not_ resolved in the master branch.
fields.summary: Issue transition hooks should only apply on repo's main branch (BB-9461)

fields.description:
I often need to tag teammates in issue comments to gather their input but I often end up tagging random people due to the lack of prioritization when it comes to teammate tagging.

For example:

One of our project managers, Kelaine, has the tag {{@kelaine}} but if I get to {{@kel}} and press enter, it tags "Kel" (another user apparently) instead of auto-filling the rest of her name. I very rarely (never actually) have to tag people outside of my org. in our private repos so either defaulting to teammates first or allowing only teammate autocomplete in org repos would be very helpful.
fields.summary: When tagging people, prioritize teammates over exact username matches (BB-9462)

fields.description: hard tab indented code which contains several nested blocks is difficult to read.  if you were to set [tab-size|https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/tab-size] to something reasonable (2? 4? 6?), i'd find code reviewing here much easier.
fields.summary: hard tabs should be displayed as less than 8 spaces (BB-9466)

fields.description:
Attempting to clone our repo with git 1.8.3.1 (Fedora 19) is consistently failing(sometimes gets up to 2/3 of the way through and hangs and eventually fails with a "fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly"

However using git 1.7.9.5 (Ubuntu 12.04) works as expected with the same ssh:// url.
fields.summary: Clone failure with git 1.8.3.1

fields.description:
I propose this feature because i work on many projects that have a personal fork and I often have to compare a branch of the original project to a different branch of its fork. Actually, each time you go in the compare view, 'master' branches are selected by default for the origin and the fork. It would be very useful if bitbucket reminds which branches were last selected for a project.\\
What do you think ?
fields.summary: Automatic saving of last compared branches in the compare view (BB-9465)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have not only a link to the parent commit(s) but also to child commit(s) if existent.

Currently, if I want to walk my way through a branch (e.g. a pull request) in chronological order I always have to go back to the list of commits to select the next one.

Walking through the branch in reverse chronological order is straightforward throught the parent link, but having the opposite option too would be an enhancement.
fields.summary: Add links to child commits on commit detail page

fields.description:
I think the display of the commit message is pracitcally hidden on the commit details page.

As it is I have the committer's avatar, then a formatted line with information about committer and date.\\
While this is nice the next line with the commit message's first line is completely un-formatted, and one practically has to search for it.

I think on the detail page for a commit this first line is the '<h1'> entry and should be the most prominent item on the page.

I suggest placing the commit message header above the avatar and format it the same size as 'Comments' and 'Files changed' but bold. I don't have an opinion whether the line with the link to the commits list and the committish should be above or below that heading.

The avatar should be beside the commit details (just as it is right now), and I suggest placing the body of the commit message below that and put it in a box.

Sorry to say, but this is actually better at GitHub.\\
See https://github.com/wbsoft/frescobaldi/commit/2a188cc21dab975491f279cee983d3088933010e as a commit of mine. When you open that page the first thing you notice is the heading of the commit message, and that _is_ the first thing you want to see.
fields.summary: Formatting of commit message on commit details page

fields.description:
The pull request\\
https://bitbucket.org/nazya/nazya/pull-request/3402/threading/diff#chg-nazya/base/sources/taobao/parser.py\\
merged, but I didn't do it and the sourse code doesn't incude changes from this pull request.
fields.summary: My pull request was merged but i didn't do it

fields.description:
Hi,

I have a problem when trying to commit. It always asks for a password even though I have the key correctly configured.

I tried to log in with ssh and this happened:

{code}
#!bash

OpenSSH_5.9p1, OpenSSL 0.9.8y 5 Feb 2013
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh_config line 20: Applying options for *
debug1: /etc/ssh_config line 53: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [131.103.20.168] port 22.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /Users/<edited out>/.ssh/id_rsa type 1
debug1: identity file /Users/<edited out>/.ssh/id_rsa-cert type -1
debug1: Remote protocol version 2.0, remote software version OpenSSH_5.3
debug1: match: OpenSSH_5.3 pat OpenSSH*
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_5.9
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT sent
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEXINIT received
debug1: kex: server->client aes128-ctr hmac-md5 none
debug1: kex: client->server aes128-ctr hmac-md5 none
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REQUEST(1024<1024<8192) sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_GROUP
debug1: SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_INIT sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_KEX_DH_GEX_REPLY
debug1: Server host key: RSA 97:8c:1b:f2:6f:14:6b:5c:3b:ec:aa:46:46:74:7c:40
debug1: Host 'bitbucket.org' is known and matches the RSA host key.
debug1: Found key in /Users/<edited out>/.ssh/known_hosts:1
debug1: ssh_rsa_verify: signature correct
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS sent
debug1: expecting SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS
debug1: SSH2_MSG_NEWKEYS received
debug1: Roaming not allowed by server

debug1: SSH2_MSG_SERVICE_ACCEPT received

Permission denied (publickey).

{code}

I have tried to add my public key to the authorized_keys file in another machine and I could connect without issues, so I am confident the problem is not on my side, but maybe I am wrong.

Either way I don't know what else to try.

Thank you very much for your time.
fields.summary: Problem with ssh key

fields.description:
Error I am receiving

Something went wrong.

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
7ead1b80ca45466db7659f0d018c4b38
fields.summary: 500 error on trying to see commits on web browser

fields.description:
I've committed a change with a "Fixes #xxx" comment. The commit is listed under my username. But the issue is closed by our TEAM-ACCOUNT instead.

Here: https://bitbucket.org/jitbit/macro-recorder/commits/all (list of commits)\\
https://bitbucket.org/jitbit/macro-recorder/overview (issues closed by TEAM account)
fields.summary: issues closed by commit-messages are closed by team-account (BB-9460)

fields.description: I set up a POST hook on my repository, and to test it I changed some files using the online editor. The hook was not triggered any of the times I tried to use the online editor, but it worked fine when I cloned the repo and pushed a commit to it.
fields.summary: Mercurial hooks are not called when using online editor (BB-9459)

fields.description: Some wikis have support for redirection from one page to another. Bitbucket's wikis should support this, if they don't already. (I don't see any documentation on how to do this, so I assume it's not supported.)
fields.summary: Redirect support for wiki pages

fields.description:
I created a repository at:\\
[https://bitbucket.org/marcusma_1spatial/marcusma_1spatial|https://bitbucket.org/marcusma_1spatial/marcusma_1spatial]\\
which brings up a 500 error with this:\\
34a295cff66d4088ab3462bfcc9deba9

Ideally I would like this repository deleted, as I successfully managed\\
to create another one instead.
fields.summary: My repository that I created is not accessible

fields.description:
This morning Chrome gave me a malware warning in our hosted JIRA dashboard.

Here are the details provided through chrome's advanced tools:\\
http://safebrowsing.clients.google.com/safebrowsing/diagnostic?site=http%3A%2F%2Fssn.storman.com%2Fimages%2Fv2moonraker%2Fgeneric%2Ficon_paintbrush128.png&client=googlechrome&hl=en-US
fields.summary: Malware reported in JIRA

fields.description:
Using a git fork-clone-pull workflow, it's necessary sometimes to demo the pull request from the forked repository.

Currently you have to make sure you have all the appropriate permissions and pull down the forked repo which uses unnecessary time, space and bandwidth.

I propose a patch url where you could download a git patch that could be applied temporarily to your own pulled repo to demo the pull request.
fields.summary: Link to a PR's raw patch from the UI

fields.description:
We would like to add clones and pushes activities to the audit logging as it would help us to keep track of:
# The active users
# The owner of the content being pushed to Bitbucket (especially when it does not match with the "committer")
# After maintenance such as BFG and LFS, who did clone the latest version of the repository.

These changes would be related to the feature http://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/08/15/new-audit-logs-give-you-the-who-what-when-and-where/
fields.summary: Add clones and pushes to audit logging (BB-9452)

fields.description:
Currently if I write title of issue in russian (for example), then I'll get ugly link to this issue:

https://bitbucket.org/nartamonov/echd/issue/4/------------------------------------------

All foreign alphabetic symbols are replaced by dashes. I propose two possible and more appropriate solutions:

# Strip all dashes altogether, so link becomes: https://bitbucket.org/nartamonov/echd/issue/4/
# Use transliteration, so link becomes:

https://bitbucket.org/nartamonov/echd/issue/4/bolshie-archivi-zagrujayutsa-ne-polnostiju
fields.summary: Improve support of foreign languages in issue titles (BB-9458)

fields.description:
* Created a pull request (B) to merge into an existing branch (A).
* (A) also had a pull request pending to go into our dev branch.
* (A) was approved and merged into develop and has been closed.
* So now (B) WOULD be trying to merge into a closed branch - because the branch is closed bitbucket shows an error that the diff cannot be created.

I tried to edit (B) to be a pull request into develop instead of into the closed branch (A) - but I see the following error on submitting my changes to the pull request(B):\\
{{The following error(s) occurred saving this pull request. Can't create branch feature/view-payments since it already exists in Carleton (Android).}}

I have no way to delete or update B, and since A is closed there is no diff available to properly review B.
fields.summary: Pull requests to a closed branch cannot be updated to point to an open branch (BB-9464)

fields.description:
Hi,

See attached screenshot.

When logged in, Gravatars aren't loading in the GUI. This happens on FF 24 on Linux Mint Debian Edition.

The Gravatars are loading properly on Chromium version 28.0.1500.95 Debian jessie/sid (213514) on Linux Mint Debian Edition.

Cheers, Martijn
fields.summary: Gravatars not loading in FF 24 on Linux

fields.description: I discovered if a user with a name like {{__John_Smith__}} exists, I cannot mention them using @. The underscores seem to be parsed as formatting _before_ the @.
fields.summary: Can't mention users with leading underscores in names (BB-9457)

fields.description:
It would be nice if +1's were not emailed to all watchers as they add nothing but an annoyance.  Instead convert the +1 to a vote which is, I'm sure, what the poster means to do but fails to see the "Vote for this issue"

Alternatively, place "Vote for this issue" right below the comment box alerting the user of how issue etiquette should work.

You win twice, no one get's spammed and issues have the correct vote count!

Now I need to unwatch this issue as I'm sure to get trolled with some +1's :)
fields.summary: Prevent +1's from being emailed

fields.description:
There is a "manifest" REST API endpoint for this that is undocumented and seemingly broken. I found it via the apigee browser:

curl https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/aslakhellesoy/pygments-main/manifest/a32d7988c3695e0b0a41cf764afaa9e701a858e7

(The apigee API browser suggests a trailing slash, which didn't work).

Anyway, this will only list the files at the root of the repository. I don't know if it's possible to make it behave recursively.

Is there another way to list all files in a repo (for a given revision)? We'd very much like to support Bitbucket in https://cucumber.pro, but we need this functionality to do so.
fields.summary: REST API: List all files in repo (like git ls-files) (BB-9449)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have the option of importing code from an outside repository as just a set of files, without the branches, history, etc.   It would be the equivalent of (but faster and easier than) checking out a repository to a local computer, creating a new repository on Bitbucket, and then checking in the individual files.

If the repository is just being created to have a place to save local patches, the external history is just noise.  And it would have the side effect of allowing the conversion between different repository types.

Suggested:  Add an option to the "Old Repository" portion of the repo/import page similar to "Import Full Repository History" that defaults to yes.
fields.summary: Allow import of bare code without repository history

fields.description:
I wanted to import a remote Mercurial repository as a Bitbucket Git repository.  When I tried this, the "Repository Type" option was grayed out.   I  don't need it to import the history or commits, just the contents.  It would be nice if this was possible.

This appears to be possible from Subversion at Google Code, and thus presumably could be done from Mercurial as well.  I presume that Mercurial users would like to have the reverse option as well.

Suggested Feature: Allow user to select their desired new repository type, adding a note to the effect that "history will be lost" if this is selected.
fields.summary: Import Mercurial repository but create as Git

fields.description:
If you choose Google Code and then enter a valid name, the inoperable URL box is filled and a green check mark appears.

If you then switch to Mercurial, the URL becomes editable and green check remains.

If you then switch back to Google Code, the URL box becomes inoperable again but the contents disappear. The green check stays.

Switch back to Mercurial, and the URL box is empty and editable with a green check.

Why was I doing this?  Because I couldn't figure out the interface, was trying to paste in the URL I'd already copied, and presumed that the Name was what  I wanted to call it on Bitbucket.  I selected Google Code because that was one of the options, and then was confused as to what it was doing.

Suggested solution:  Remove "Name", get rid of "Source",  and just letting users paste in a URL and select a repository type.  You could probably even autoselect the repository type.  Users who are importing repositories can be expected to know how to copy a URL.
fields.summary: UI bug on import when switching Source (BB-9448)

fields.description:
I came to file a tiny bug, but was unable to search for Open bugs matching the term "import" without hand editing the URL.   It's possible this is by design, but as this is basic functionality that seems unlikely.   So I'll file this one first.

To reproduce:

Option A)\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues\\
Enter the term "import" in the Find Issues box.\\
Click on Filters: Open.

Option B)\\
https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issues\\
Click on Filters: Open\\
Enter the term "import" in Find Issues box.

What I expect: To receive Open issues matching the term "import"

What happens: I only get Open issues, or issues matching "import", but am unable to combine the two searches.

Workaround: Click on Filters: Open, then add "&q=import" to the URL.
fields.summary: Unable to filter to existing search of issues by status

fields.description: See [BB-9444|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9444]
fields.summary: Selecting team issue filter also lists private repo issues (BB-9444)

fields.description:
From https://twitter.com/rickyrobinson/status/392266075653406720\\
Why is this so Verbose?

h2. git
{code}
mkdir /path/to/your/project
cd /path/to/your/project
git init
git remote add origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/mbertrand80/cloneme.git
{code}

h2. hg
{code}
mkdir /path/to/your/project
cd /path/to/your/project
hg clone ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/mbertrand80/example3
{code}

In both of the above, why not just have the clone command?

Going through the workflow... There is really only the second step. This makes the four tabs a bit strange when you think about it. As soon as the customer does the second step, thats it... They'll never see the rest!
fields.summary: Make the 'blank slate' for repos have better/smarter copy (BB-9442)

fields.description:
{code:text}
[root]# git push origin master

Password:

Counting objects: 12519, done.

Delta compression using up to 16 threads.

Compressing objects: 100% (11363/11363), done.

**error: RPC failed; result=56, HTTP code = 100**

Writing objects: 100% (12517/12517), 17.82 MiB | 35 KiB/s, done.

Total 12517 (delta 5471), reused 0 (delta 0)
{code}

--------------------git.config--------------------------------

{code}
[core]

        repositoryformatversion = 0

        filemode = true

        bare = false

        logallrefupdates = true

[remote "origin"]

        fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*

        url = https://lockmind@bitbucket.org/lockmind/jbus.git

[branch "master"]

        remote = origin

        merge = refs/heads/master

[http]

        postBuffer = 524288000
{code}

git version 1.7.1
fields.summary: error: RPC failed; result=56, HTTP code = 100

fields.description: Currently, there is no code highlighting inside diffs, shown by pull requests mechanism. It can be improved.
fields.summary: Improve code highlighting inside pull requests (BB-3046)
SSH Keys page - Something went wrong (BB-9438)

fields.description: where would i locate the jenkins build key for Repository link
fields.summary: Jenkins build key

fields.description:
Hi.

I push on the "Delete" button and nothing happens. This appers when filenames contain cyrrilic characters or spaces.

Regards.
fields.summary: Can't remove files from downloads (BB-9434)

fields.description:
After one of commits , in my private repository , I cant  download zip file anymore , its downloading but file was damaged , and not complete.\\
On that repository I can easily download files in gz and bz2 formats as well.\\
Also on my other repositories zip download working  well.\\
I tried to clean up repository but it wont help.\\
I am using SmartGit HG for pushing commits , and post hook.

One of times that i want to download zip manually i get 500 error

http://gyazo.com/f5c16a772e7e7bcddb9bcb9eedb19742
fields.summary: Zip download problem

fields.description:
Now when user does online edits / merges, email address used for record such commits is the "primary" one. That address is however used _also_ for account related notifications and mainly for _login_ and password recovery.

Hence, by doing online edits this email address is compromised.

This could be prevented if user had the option to instruct system to use other verified email address, preferably one matching his regular public Git identity.
fields.summary: Allow users to use alternative identities for commits made online (BB-9432)

fields.description: Such that {{https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/{user}/{slug}/commits/{branch}}} doesn't traverse all the way to the (Mercurial) repo's root, but only returns direct ancestors that are on the same named branch.
fields.summary: Support Mercurial named branches in commits API (don't traverse to the root) (BB-9430)

fields.description:
If the rest API is called from a browser (somedomain.com) with some headers in the request (i.e. Authorization), the browser first initiates an OPTIONS request as per w3c specs herer - http://www.w3.org/TR/cors/

Unfortunately BitBucket's REST api returns 405 response instead of 200 on those OPTIONS requests.
fields.summary: REST Api does not support OPTIONS verb (BB-6559)

fields.description:
Repro:

Create a new pull request in a team repo, and start typing a few characters into the reviewers box to autocomplete a team member's name.

Expected: If a team member matches, that person is always sorted above non-team members.

Actual: if a bitbucket user id from someone outside the team matches exactly, that user ID is sorted to the top, resulting in accidental adds of people outside our org.

Example:

If I type in only 'd', 'James DeMichele' is matched and sorted at the top, but if I get to "dem" (which happens frequently because I'm a fast typist) then the bitbucket user '@ dem' is matched and sorted above 'James DeMichele', and pressing enter tries to add that person instead.
fields.summary: When adding reviewers in pull requests, always sort team members to the top (BB-9439)

fields.description:
Add a way to mark versions as archived so they no longer show up on the drop-down when creating/editing an issue.

!http://www.charlestonsw.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Selection_109.png!
fields.summary: New Feature : Versions Archive

fields.description:
Side by side diff of lull/__iq_self_test.lull in https://bitbucket.org/1spatial/gde_iqlib/pull-request/1/goth-24948-fix-java-self-test-failures/diff (in a private repository) displays part of the changes incorrectly.

In the attached image, lines 242-244 incorrectly repeat lines 239-241 and all subsequent RHS line numbers are wrong.

Note also that on Chrome the side-by-side diff doesn't fill the view - there are unnecessary horizontal scrollbars and lines are truncated.
fields.summary: side-by-side diff sometimes displays changes incorrectly (BB-9428)

fields.description: Pull requests are great, and so is the review process with its comments, notifications and the ability to update pull requests. However, when a pull request is updated, I would like to review just the changes introduced in the update. I think this could be done with an interdiff (show a diff between the previous and the current state of the pull request branch) or by color coding (for instance: the newest changes have a green/red background like the normal diff, older changes have a faded green/red background).
fields.summary: Review diff between pull request updates (BB-9427)
[deleted]

fields.description:
Error 500.\\
Debug hash 00cb3a20ee204976a531569d35ff98a1.
fields.summary: Google login linking to existing Bitbucket account already linked with a Google account fails (BB-8475)

fields.description:
We've been getting 500 errors all day. We created pull request from fork and while that we got 500-error, but instead of this, pull request has been created, so we try to merge it. The problem that we can't just open to see the content. So we can't decline it. Here is one of the ids from a recent failure: ff6f1d25bf6545e1b9f1da109e4d0006

So is there any way to solve this problem on my own?
fields.summary: 500 errors when attempting to view a pull request (BB-9422)

fields.description: In the branches view, we only show open pull requests that are to be merged into the main branch. It would good to show branches that are pointing to other deployment branches.
fields.summary: Show pull requests with a destination other than main branch (BB-9424)

fields.description:
I tried creating a private repo.

As soon as I pressed the create button it showed me 500 error along with this code:

da5581617e3d435daca654441dfc1131

Please help.

Regards,\\
Bandana
fields.summary: 500 error when created a private repo

fields.description:
Hi ,

We are getting below exception while cloning the bitbucket repository in Eclipse.

" Exception caught during execution of ls-remote command:\\
ssh://git@bitbucket.org/user/repository.git: ProxyHTTP: java.io.IOException: proxy error: Proxy Authorization Required.\\
"\\
Also sending the screen shot for the same. Please let us know what internet settings we need to do at our end.
fields.summary: Git setup issue for cloning of repository

fields.description:
Small detail: when I enter a revision to strip on the {{/<user>/<repo>/admin/strip}} page, whitespace isn't removed from the value before you try to look it up.

Since the value I enter often comes from some text I've selected with the mouse, I'll often include a space before or after the value. It would be nice if you stripped that before reporting that the revision cannot be found.
fields.summary: "Revision to strip" input field should strip whitespace (BB-9421)

fields.description:
Like many developers, I have projects that I work on that are mine and others that belong to my organization. I'm lucky enough to work for a company that uses BitBucket; but, this forces me to decide whether all of the notifications from BitBucket should go to my personal address or my work address (since notifications always go to the primary email account).

It would be a significant improvement to be able to specify which email address notifications go to for a repository OR to simply be able to link one of my email addresses to an organization that I belong to and then have all notifications on repositories in that organization go to that address.
fields.summary: Link email address to repository or organization to dictate where notifications are sent.

fields.description:
If a user makes a large commit (hundreds of megabytes) it can be hard to fix it, as everyone downstream may be required to manually rebase their own work.

(And if anyone forgets to rebase, they might push the large commit back to the repository again, starting the work all over again.)

We'd like to set a threshold size for a given commit. If the commit is greater than N bytes, it should only be allowed to be pushed by an administrator.
fields.summary: Allow only certain users to make large commits (megabytes) (BB-9416)

fields.description:
We'd like to block commits that do/don't match a regular expression.

This is a fork of Issue BCLOUD-5658, which is a very popular issue, but it's also pretty tricky to support _arbitary_ custom hooks. Instead, we just want a limited subset of that functionality.

Regular expressions will address 80% of our needs at 20% of the cost.

(For extra credit: let us specify branches by regular expression, too, so if someone checks into a branch named "release-.*" the commit must contain the text "Approved by:")
fields.summary: Block commits by regular expression (BB-9418)

fields.description: See [BB-9413|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-9413]
fields.summary: £ in hook password causes hook to fail (BB-9413)

fields.description:
Currently

https://www.nuget.org/packages/log4net.GrowlAppender/ returns a 404 while\\
https://www.nuget.org/packages/log4net.growlappender/ works (even though I named my project with PascalCase).

It was a minor annoyance in that I had published a nuget package referencing the url with the PascalCase and had to go update my package and increment a patch version number just to get the url to resolve.

Perhaps you disagree, but I think that this breaks a common web convention for case insensitivity in urls
fields.summary: Allow case-invariant urls

fields.description:
We had a pull request with two commits, one of which turned out to be unnecessary. After stripping the second commit in the source repository, the pull request broke.

It broke in the sense that trying to update it gave us a page where the reviewers field was unstyled so one could see that it's a select field. The preview below (showing the commits in the pull request) never finished loading.

Going back to the overview page, we could decline the request. When we did so, the overview diff showed the expected diff once again — it had been showing the "Nothing to merge, all changesets already exist in the destination repo" message after we stripped the second changeset from the source repo.

Let me know if the above makes sense, if not I'll try to reproduce it and post some screenshots.
fields.summary: Pull requests gets into a bad state after stripping a source changeset (BB-10087)

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/merlin-ondemand/compass/commits/0e077b08943e08211e38b18efbd8f647e2ab03b2

this shows as unknown user, but shouldn't be, as the user was Jason on this page:\\
https://bitbucket.org/merlin-ondemand/compass

Also, now Jason's having trouble doing a push or pull on this repo..  not sure if that's related, or what..  we're all pretty new to git.
fields.summary: "Unknown" user commit on a private repo

fields.description:

See image for details: http://i.imgur.com/PDJZU30.png

fields.description:
I'm using Mac version sourcetree1.7.3.\\
I've set the diff tool as "Other" and point to my vimdiff path, the Arguments is "-d $LOCAL $REMOTE". Then use the External Diff button, there is only LOCAL file but no REMOTE file. My macvim hint the REMOTE file path is /private/var/folders/m4/f_hd3wgd3xv4_7gch2r4p3h80000gn/T/HNkd6f_test.py

But there is no such file.

fields.description:
Plus signs {{+}} are invisible in tweets sent by the Twitter hook, as in https://twitter.com/vx68k/status/390030550679175168

They should be escaped if possible.
fields.summary: Plus signs should be escaped by the Twitter hook? (BB-9415)

fields.description: Crucible had a very nice facility to create code review by story id. Bitbucket's light weight review process is good, but the reviewer needs to spend a lot of time to review a complete story if it has a number of commits. It would be a great value add to have this feature in the commits tab under JIRA (separate from the pull request in bitbucket).
fields.summary: Ability to review multiple commits by story ID

fields.description:
Hi !

Would it be possible to add "xtend" as a programming language option for bitbucket projects ?

This is the website http://www.eclipse.org/xtend/

Although it generates java code, one usually just version the .xtend files into the repository.

Thanks!

Regards
fields.summary: Request to Add XTend Language to Programming Language (BB-9414)
Support internal/anchor links in rendered Markdown

fields.description:
I am trying to upload our downloadable files which are about 400MB in size. However, this has now failed about 10 times.

I think the Internet might have something to do with it or not. But if it does, it would be good to support a resume feature.

It would also be good if we can upload a file from a Web Link. The reason is that we do not seem to have any trouble uploading the same size files using Drop as an example, so we could stage the downloads there and then provide the link to BitBucket for downloads.
fields.summary: Supporting Large Downloads (BB-9412)

fields.description: I created a new branch with a bookmark and pushed it.  I can see the [commits for the branch here|https://bitbucket.org/cjerdonek/tox-125-randomseed/commits/branch/hashseed-optional] but clicking the page for the branch in the pull-down [gives a 404|https://bitbucket.org/cjerdonek/tox-125-randomseed/branch/hashseed-optional].
fields.summary: clicking on branch gives 404 dead link (BB-9411)

fields.description: In addition to [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Resolve%2Bissues%2Bautomatically%2Bwhen%2Busers%2Bpush%2Bcode], it would be also very helpful to see a Branch name in comments of an issue, where the branch name would be like "issue#3".
fields.summary: Include branch name in comments made by the issue hook (BB-9417)

fields.description:
Hi,

My team uses bitbucket (under the accademic 'price plan')  for all of our projects. Recently we have been writing presentations in latex beamer. This involves importing SVG files into the repo.

We like the ability to have changes mailed to the team, but we got tired of the  large diffs detailing the changes to the SVG files. We decided to dump a .gitattributes file into our repo:

{code}
*.svg -diff
{code}

This is enough for local git tools (like gitk) to consider the SVGs as binary, but bitbucket will still mail diffs against these files. I propose that it should not.

Thanks
fields.summary: Diff emails do not respect gitattributes (BB-9410)
Show command needed to pull changesets in a pull request (BB-9408)

fields.description: Everytime I try to access 'source' of one of my private repos I get an error with the code 500. This only occurs on that specific repo.
fields.summary: 500 when trying to access source

I'm specifically thinking about issue editors but it would be great for every editor on Bitbucket. Hit Ctrl+S and it is saved, no need to click a button.

What do you think?

fields.description:
After merging a pull request and selecting close source branch, a link still appears at the top of the screen with the source branch (now closed) which leads to an error screen since the branch is not visible anymore.

In the attached image, prodpos-303 is the closed branch, but the link still appears when hovering the mouse over it, this is the screen for the previously merged pull request.
fields.summary: Git : Link to closed branch still appears when viewing pull requests merged (BB-9403)

fields.description: We have several repos for our various client projects. It would be nice to have a way to get a report of the total number of commits/size of commits from all of our developers over time. I'm curious to know which developers are the most and least active. I can do this on Github, but I don't see how to do it on Bitbucket. It would be nice if we could do a summary of all repos rather than a report of each repo.
fields.summary: Improved Reports

fields.description:
Steps:

# Come to Downloads section
# Press Delete link on against file

The file should be removed. But I go to page https://bitbucket.org/name/repo/downloads/delete and it shows "File not found."

The repository has been renamed and moved from the private to the public. No problems with the download of this file. But it still is not removed.
fields.summary: Can't delete file from downloads

fields.description: Normally when you assign an issue to a team member, the number of issues appear in that team member's dashboard and are easily accessible through it. But if you assign an issue to a team, neither the team or the team members get this same indication of number of issues assigned to them. I think it would be good if either all issues assigned to teams are added to individual team member dashboard views, or have the same number of issues indication appear when viewing the team dashboard.
fields.summary: issues assigned to teams to not appear in team view

fields.description: I have Firefox with the NoScript plugin (http://noscript.net/). My configuration (obviously ?) blocks the "google-analytics.com" domain. But this setting causes some dynamic parts of the site to malfunction (to name a few : the watch dropdown, the access management list, the branch management list, etc...). The site is quite unusable.
fields.summary: Blocking Google Analytics breaks the site

fields.description:
I have been trying to add my g***@*****.co email address to my bitbucket account for a while now to no avail.  I have tried to add the email, and resend the invitation multiple times.  It is currently sitting in an unapproved status on my account.

I recently sent a coworker a similar invite to b***@*****.co, and he has reported that as of the writing of this issue he has not yet received it.

Could this be an issue with .co TLD's?   My *****.co email is hosted via Rackspace, but so are the other two email addresses I have (a .net and a .com) and those work perfectly.

Please let me know if I can provide any more detail to help you debug this.
fields.summary: Email invitations sent to .co TLD domains are not being delivered.

fields.description:
I'm not sure what the precise cause is, but MathJax is failing to render correctly when I follow this link:

https://bitbucket.org/davidsd/open-bootstrap-collaboration/wiki/LaTeX%20Test.rst#!latex-test

However, if I remove the '#!latex-test' from the url, it loads fine.  This is an issue for me because the automatically generated TOC here:

https://bitbucket.org/davidsd/open-bootstrap-collaboration/wiki/Home

has links that include the '#!' stuff.
fields.summary: MathJax in Wiki fails when url contains '#!' (BB-9396)

fields.description:
The Mercurial mirror here on Bitbucket has received a [pull request for the German translation|https://bitbucket.org/mirror/mercurial/pull-request/1/translated-some-messages-for-depo/diff]. I went and told the guy that we don't use the mirror for development and that we don't even control it.

That added me as a reviewer on the pull request, which is fine. The pull request now shows up in my [pull requests overview|https://bitbucket.org/dashboard/pullrequests] and I don't think I can remove it from there: I cannot decline the pull request since I don't control the {{mirror/mercurial}} repository and I cannot remove myself as a reviewer.

I've remove myself as a watcher from the pull request, but that doesn't influence the overview.
fields.summary: Cannot remove myself as pull request reviewer

fields.description:
Hi guys,\\
I am really missing (maybe I didn't find it yet) the feature from github to compare forks, like this: [GitHub Comparison|https://github.com/etianen/django-reversion/network]

It helps to see if certaint bugs/features have been fixed/added in other forks.

Thanks and keep up the good work!\\
Gabriel

fields.description:
Our development environment has some requirements as far as source code checking/formatting and test automation.

As such, we would like to avoid giving anyone the option of using the Bitbucket online editor to directly edit files in the remote repo.

Would it be possible to add a repo-level configuration setting to disable the online editor in all places (source tab, pull requests, any other source viewers) where it is normally available for that repo?
fields.summary: Add repo level configuration item to disable online editor (BB-9393)

I do not want to publish here specific information about my repository/branches...
fields.summary: Bitbucket hangs while merging pull request...

fields.description: It would be helpful to see any decline or approve comments in the Overview tab. I realise they show up on the Activity tab, but as they are major milestones in the life of a PR, it would make sense to show them in the Overview.

Yogesh
fields.summary: Unable to register from home page and simple-signup page

fields.description:
The 2 options for Commit emails aren't very useful. For example, if I'd like to notify a fellow coder of a change I made, I certainly would never send them this:

1 new commit in MagicRepo:

https://bitbucket.org/b9chris/magicrepo/commits/b360b69bbac6/\\
Changeset:   b360b69bbac6\\
Branch:      SupportUsChanges\\
User:        bramlage\\
Date:        2013-10-05 05:52:03\\
Summary:     Updated SupportUs/Index.cshtml Store, still waiting on full product views and paypal buttons for two new shirts

Affected #:  6 files

Repository URL: https://bitbucket.org/b9chris/magicrepo/

--

This is a commit notification from bitbucket.org. You are receiving\\
this because you have the service enabled, addressing the recipient of\\
this email.

That's a ton of chaff for the one thing that's actually useful about that email:

Updated SupportUs/Index.cshtml Store, still waiting on full product views and paypal buttons for two new shirts

Except often the actual commit message I want to see is clipped.

I assume some users are using this bad-for-humans email in systems automation, so would it be possible to add a third more usable email option? Happy to work with you on the format. Here's an initial proposal:

Subject:

MagicRepo - 3 commits - b9chris - 2013-10-30

(Date prevents Gmail from threading update emails infinitely)

Body:

(no summary of how many commits - that's clear from the list of commits we're about to iterate)

*2013-10-05 05:52:03*\\
Updated SupportUs/Index.cshtml Store, still waiting on full product views and paypal buttons for two new shirts

Update me when stills available.

SupportUs/Index.cshtml +6, -3, *7

branch: SupportUsChanges

So, you get the full commit message, instead of presuming that just the first line is all that's important. Most of the irrelevant stuff like a link to commit, the commit hash, etc is left out - all fine things to have but they can be found just fine on their own and aren't relevant to a quick summary. Then a summary of changed files with number of lines added, removed, changed. Branch is at the end since it's rarely a value you don't already anticipate (whatever your workflow), but occasionally relevant.
fields.summary: Better format for email hook (BB-9388)
